Description: Rim sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery open vessel, perhaps a lekane with root of handle; white slip (much worn); interior reserved with black bands; exterior: at rim, short vertical strokes; below, to left,three black bands; central. plastic female head with headdress decorated with diagonal lines; painted facial features and dotted necklace; at right, between black bands, black-figure decoration consisting of lion to right (head and forelegs missing; added red on hind leg); incised corner rosettes with red centres; apparent handle scar below plastic head.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see the rather more elaborate piece Lemos no. 1438, from Phana.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1392, pl. 178)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 102,-3 no. 308.5, pl. XXX)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. XII, no. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2062) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 213, no. 25)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5989 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
